channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Ardern signals maternity mental health support if Labour wins
item.description: The government needs to do more to help the parents of babies who die in their first year, Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern says.

item.title: Legality of lockdown case: 'government, like every person, is ruled by the law'
item.description: The public gallery in the High Court in Wellington was packed for the first day of a judicial review about whether the country was put into level 4 lockdown lawfully.

item.title: M훮ori families feel ignored by Family Court judges - report
item.description: Most wh훮nau M훮ori going through the Family Court feel ignored by judges and are left to navigate a confusing system without support, a new report has found.

item.title: University 'naive' to partner with Chinese institute, security expert says
item.description: An international security expert has criticised Canterbury University over its partnership with a Chinese Institute which is closely linked to the military.

item.title: Fight to stop water bottling expansion reaches High Court
item.description: The fight to stop a major international company from taking a billion litres of water a year from the Awaiti Aquifer near Whakat훮ne has reached the High Court.

item.title: Papakura electorate: Labour backbencher faces off against Collins
item.description: After one term in Parliament, Labour backbencher Anahila Kanongata'a-Suisuiki has the daunting task of taking on Judith 'Crusher' Collins for the seat of Papakura.

item.title: Police, Medsafe 'raid' New Zealand bleach 'cure' seller
item.description: Police and Medsafe have raided the property of a man who sells a bleach he claims can cure Covid-19, RNZ understands.

item.title: Ardern announces $51.6m for international education sector
item.description: Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern and Education Minister Chris Hipkins have announced $51.6m from the Covid-19 recovery fund for the international education sector.

item.title: Fiordland faces 40 percent unemployment after storms, Covid-19
item.description: This year the region has been hit by severe flooding that cut access to Milford Sound during peak season, before Covid-19 deprived it over about three quarters of its usual visitors.

item.title: Slips at Mangamuka Gorge hold up re-opening of SH1
item.description: Two large slips have delayed the re-opening of State Highway 1 through the Mangamuka Gorge in Northland.

item.title: Activists blockade Taranaki Ballance Agri Nutrients factory over climate change concerns
item.description: Protesters have blockaded the entrance to a Ballance Agri Nutrients factory in Taranaki, saying they are preventing the distribution of synthetic nitrogen fertiliser.

item.title: Person airlifted after crash in Auckland
item.description: A person is in a critical condition after a crash in northwest Auckland this afternoon.

item.title: Person who travelled from NZ to South Korea tests positive for Covid-19
item.description: The Ministry of Health is seeking more information after a person who last week travelled from New Zealand tested positive for Covid-19 in South Korea.

item.title: Joseph Auga Matamata sentenced to 11 years for human trafficking and slavery
item.description: Joseph Auga Matamata has been sentenced to 11 years in prison on human trafficking and slavery convictions.

item.title: Crash brings downs power lines in South Auckland
item.description: A crash in the South Auckland suburb of Papatoetoe has resulted in power lines being brought down.

item.title: Suspicious Southland fire being investigated
item.description: Police in Southland are investigating a suspicious fire which destroyed a garden shed at a residential property early yesterday.

item.title: Covid-19: Zero new cases in New Zealand today
item.description: There are no new cases of Covid-19 in the country today.

item.title: Otago teachers frequently attacked by students, survey reveals
item.description: A five-week survey has recorded more than 200 physical and verbal attacks on staff at 15 Otago schools.
